concept.title: Smith-Corona Typewriter Cases and Care Considerations
concept.shortdesc: Portable Smith-Corona typewriters are typically stored in protective cases designed to prevent staining and wear, with specific care needs depending on the case material

section.title: Smith-Corona Holiday Case
section.p: Portable Smith-Corona machines are commonly stored in a case known as the “Holiday Case.” This case is slightly larger than standard typewriter carriers and can be disassembled. Like Smith-Corona typewriter panels, Holiday Cases are made of a non-porous material that resists staining, allowing most marks to be removed with mild soap and water.

section.title: Alternate Case Styles
section.p: Some machines were sold in different styles of cases. The care process for these cases varies based on their materials and construction.
Cases made of other materials may have hinges that need to be unscrewed for removal rather than unhooked. The cleaning solution required may also differ depending on the case’s material.

section.title: Machines Without Cases
section.p: Some Smith-Corona models were shipped with only a dust cover instead of a full portable case. In such cases, steps related to case frames and hinges may not apply. Machines without a case or dust cover benefit from being stored in one, as doing so extends the overall life of the typewriter.

section.note: For leather, cloth, or carpet-style cases, the cleaning solution should be selected carefully. Research and patch test all detergents and cleaners before use to prevent damage or discoloration.
